item.title: Covid: India on UK travel red list as Covid crisis grows
item.description: The rule change effectively bans travel amid soaring infection rates and a rapidly rising death toll.

item.title: India Covid crisis: Hospitals buckle under record surge
item.description: Families of Covid patients are pleading for hospital care as emergency rooms and wards overflow.

item.title: Convicted Post Office workers have names cleared
item.description: Judges quash convictions of 39 former postmasters after the UK's most widespread miscarriage of justice.

item.title: US joins race to find stricken Indonesia submarine
item.description: Indonesia is trying to rescue 53 crew on board a missing submarine before their oxygen runs out.

item.title: Covid pushes UK borrowing to highest since WW2
item.description: The government borrowed Â£303bn in the year to March, reflecting the cost of measures to support the economy.

item.title: East Jerusalem clashes leave over 100 injured
item.description: Tensions boil over into some of the worst violence in the Israeli-occupied sector for months.

item.title: Dyson leak row: Don't lock ministers in ivory towers, says senior Tory
item.description: Sir Bernard Jenkin says ministers need some privacy amid claims about who leaked PM-Dyson texts.

item.title: Northumberland Longridge Towers School strip club teacher banned
item.description: Richard Glenn is banned for three years over the visit to the Costa Rica lapdancing venue.

item.title: Child missing for three days after Tower Bridge fall, police confirm
item.description: City of London Police say the case is being treated as a missing person investigation.

item.title: Shock G: Digital Underground's The Humpty Dance rapper dies, aged 57
item.description: He was the co-founder of hip-hop pioneers Digital Underground and produced 2Pac's debut album.

item.title: Swindon family reunited with stolen chihuahua after 18 months
item.description: Paris was stolen from Lisa Lockey in 2019, but later found using the pet's microchip.

item.title: Memorial plaque washes up 140 miles away on Somerset beach
item.description: A memorial plaque lost in Storm Dennis is found in Somerset by a litter picker a year later.

item.title: Prince Louis: New birthday photograph as he starts nursery
item.description: The picture of Louis on his bike was taken by the Duchess of Cambridge to mark his third birthday.

item.title: Election 2021: Jackie Weaver explains parish councils
item.description: The viral sensation explains what parish councillors do and why you should vote for them on 6 May.

item.title: Watch: Moment pet dog runs on to high school race track and wins relay event
item.description: Watch the moment Holly the dog joins in the final sprint of a high school relay event in Utah and crosses the line first.

item.title: Fingerprint from 5,000 years ago found in Orkney
item.description: The print was discovered on the fragment of a clay vessel made by a Neolithic potter.

item.title: Court case delays left assault victim waiting over a year
item.description: The government has announced emergency funding to help tackle huge delays in court trials.

item.title: Covid: Those warning signs are being photographed for history
item.description: Photographer Matthew Chattle has collected hundreds of images of social distancing floor signs.

item.title: Scottish election 2021: Is this Scotlandâs climate election?
item.description: We take a look at one of the big issues of this election â and one of the biggest facing the world.

item.title: European Super League: Why were there no teams from Germany?
item.description: There's growing interest in the German model, where fans hold a controlling stake in the clubs.

item.title: Post Office scandal: What the Horizon saga is all about
item.description: The background to the case of sub-postmasters whose convictions were based on evidence from faulty IT.

item.title: Afghanistan: Have things improved since the Taliban?
item.description: With foreign forces due to leave later this year, what progress have Afghans seen in their lives?

item.title: Lockdown lip fillers gone wrong: 'My lips went black'
item.description: Clinics say more patients are needing help after going to unaccredited people during lockdown.

item.title: The Indonesian island that could host Elon Musk's new SpaceX site
item.description: A remote island could host Elon Musk's new Space X project - but its residents are not impressed.

item.title: Stranded sailor allowed to leave abandoned ship after four years
item.description: Mohammed Aisha had been living on a ship marooned off Egypt's Red Sea coast for four years.

item.title: Shopping in 10 minutes: The new supermarket battleground
item.description: A raft of app-based delivery systems now promise to bring you your groceries almost instantly.

item.title: Oscars 2021: Why the Academy 'needs to recognise casting directors'
item.description: Experts in the field explain why their role is crucial and needs recognition at the Oscars.

item.title: What is conversion therapy and will it be banned?
item.description: "Abhorrent" practices aimed at changing sexual orientation or gender identity could be banned.

item.title: 'As good as the top boys' - Leicester see off West Brom to boost Champions League hopes
item.description: Leicester move four points clear in third place in the Premier League with victory over relegation-threatened West Brom.

item.title: '50+1' ownership considered in UK government review
item.description: The UK government's fan-led review into English football will consider how the ownership of clubs is structured.

item.title: Who was the 'one bright spark amid the madness'? - Garth's team of the week
item.description: Who is rapidly developing into a fine player and which star played like he hadn't seen the newspapers? It's all in Garth Crooks' team of the week.

item.title: Carabao Cup & Premier League predictions: Lawro v Wolf Alice bassist Theo Ellis
item.description: Mark Lawrenson takes on Wolf Alice bassist Theo Ellis to make predictions for this weekend's EFL Cup final and Premier League fixtures.

item.title: La Liga: Own goal from Sofian Chakla gives Barcelona the lead against Getafe
item.description: Watch as Getafe's Sofian Chakla scores a terrible own goal during their 5-2 defeat by Barcelona in La Liga.

item.title: Which countries are on the red list and what are the quarantine rules?
item.description: India has now been added to the UK Government's Covid "red list" of countries.

item.title: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: Pubs and gyms will reopen in Scotland on Monday, as lockdown restrictions ease significantly.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: Covid: When will I get the vaccine?
item.description: People 45 or over in England are being offered a Covid vaccine.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The logistics of vaccinating millions of people across the country, as more than 33 million people receive at least one dose.

item.title: Coronavirus: What's the risk on transport?
item.description: As UK coronavirus restrictions continue to be relaxed, public transport could become much busier.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Lockdown rules: What are the restrictions in your area?
item.description: Use our search tool to find out about coronavirus rules and restrictions where you live.

item.title: What is a Covid passport and what are the UK's plans?
item.description: The government is considering how people could prove they are unlikely to transmit Covid.

item.title: Coronavirus cure: What progress are we making on treatments?
item.description: Teams around the world are looking into medicines for Covid-19 and scientists are starting to discover what works.

item.title: Covid: Which areas are being mass tested for variants?
item.description: People who live, work or travel through two south London boroughs are being urged to take a Covid-19 test.

item.title: Is the Australia-NZ travel bubble the way ahead?
item.description: Australia and New Zealand have quarantine-free travel, but will other countries follow their lead?

item.title: Covid: When can I go on holiday abroad or in the UK?
item.description: A traffic light system ranking foreign countries by coronavirus risk is to be introduced - the rules on UK holidays are also easing.

item.title: Covid: Restaurants and pubs are reopening, but what are the rules?
item.description: Pubs, cafes and restaurants will reopen in Wales and Scotland on Monday 26 April.

item.title: Covid: How do I get a lateral flow or PCR test?
item.description: Everyone in England and Scotland is being encouraged to take rapid coronavirus tests regularly.

item.title: Covid: When will children return to school and what are the rules?
item.description: Children are returning to school across the UK, after months of enforced home-schooling.

item.title: 'My sister took her life, petrified at facing her ex in court'
item.description: Gemma Robinson died just days before she was due to see her ex-partner in court.

item.title: Covid-19 in India: Why second coronavirus wave is devastating
item.description: A deadly second wave has overrun hospitals and even crematoriums in India.

item.title: The disabled doctors not believed by their colleagues
item.description: People often feel nervous when they visit a doctor, but what if you are a doctor but your colleagues don't believe you're ill?

item.title: The homeless drug addict who became a professor
item.description: Jesse Thistle, a high school dropout, overcame addiction and homelessness to pursue an academic career.

item.title: Nil-by-mouth foodie: The chef who will never eat again
item.description: Loretta Harmes hasn't eaten or tasted food for six years, but she hasn't lost her passion for cooking.
